Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Hatsumura
Reviews.Content: Well-located 1-star hotel, close to the Dam square. The owner is very helpful and friendly. Our room (number 14) was basic and clean, with a balcony, minibar, tv and free wi-fi. It's the room beside the reception desk, so it was a bit noisy. Regarding the stairs... well, in Amsterdam many hotels will be like this. Unfortunately, we happened to be carrying two suitcases weighting 20 kg each, so climbing those 37 steps was quite an exercise. So it's not recommended to mature, obese or people with heavy luggage. For the young folks, it won't be a problem though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe & Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MsShitHappens
Reviews.Content: Okay, the stair really are ROUGH, but that's not a big deal given the fact that - it's Amsterdam! - all the stairs are more or less the same and awful (good for your work out). The hotel owner is unbelievebly nice, professional and helpful. He made our stay a nice memory, thanks for that. Since this is a one star hotel you cannot really expect much (there aren't many amenities to begin), but this place has everything that you can ask from a budget hotel. It's very clean, safe, warm (excually, it's too warm, we had to keep our window open all the time), it has free wifi and a delightful owner. My only bigger problem was sleep quality. The beds are far from comfortable, they're, in fact, hospital or army bed - I'm not sure. And I'm sorry that we had to share a bathroom and the toilet - the next time I stay there I'll make sure I take the room with a bathroom and a toilet. The best thing about the hotel was it's location. It's located in the very heart of Amsterdam, behind The Dam Square. All bigger tourist sites were in walking distance. All in all it was a very pleasent experience and I would stay there again. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a backpacker or trekking Europe, this is for you, but...”
Reviews.Author: Gloria W
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: 1) The hotel owner is SUUUUUUUPER nice and helpful. That goes a long way. 2) Rooms are clean but VERY small. 3) If you're traveling on a budget or backpacking around Europe, this is a great hotel. If you're wanting some comfort and a quiet hotel with some amenities, this is not for you. 4) You will hear street noise all the time, as it sits on a main road. 5) There are not a lot of fancy amenities, but again, this is a hotel designed for the backpacker and younger people trekking across Europe. It's a roof over your head with a very nice owner and a reasonable price. If you want a fancier hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay at Hotel Pax.”
Reviews.Author: Balou1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Pax this past November which was my second stay. I arrived at the hotel around 9:30 and my room was ready. As on my previous trip in 2010, I had room 15. Everything was the same with one exception, there is now free wifi! I would recommend Hotel Pax to anyone looking for clean, safe and basic accommodation. I am also happy to report that the reno in a canal house across the courtyard is done.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pokenose
Reviews.Content: We landed in Amsterdam without any hotel bookings. The tourist office offered us this hotel and we were very glad to have stayed here. It is centrally located with the Dam square just 5-8mins by walk. Anne Frank's house is just 2 mins away. Just have to be aware that this is 1star hotel so no lift. We carried our bulky suitcases up 3 floors through the narrow and steep staircases. The helpful receptionist/owner offered us to help us with one so that was really nice. Excellent value for money as we paid â‚¬ 75 for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty little hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: MiriMuc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pax is a quite decent place to stay for a few days in Amsterdam. The Hotel and the room also where very small, but it was clean and we really enjoyed our stay there. Everyday we had fresh towels which quite suprised me. Also the owner was very friendly and answered all the questions we had about where to go. We spontaniously decided to stay a night longer - this was no problem and was handled very incomplicated. As the hotel is right in the city center you reach many sights, restaurants and bars in only a few minutes. Anne Frank Huis is just a stone's throw a way. There is also a tram station very close by the hotel. I would recommend to rent a bicyle - there is one just arround the corner. I would recommend Hotel Pax at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: amelyen
Reviews.Content: Hotel was hidden but not a far distant from the train station. The hotel staff were nice and charming. Rooms were big enough for beds but that wasn't a problem since our main purpose in Amsterdam was to explore. The community bathroom and shower proved to be no problem. For the price, this little hotel is a good find.

Reviews.Title: “What more can you want from a 1*”
Reviews.Author: Balou1999
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive 1* hotel between Dam Square and Westerkerk Check in was quick and simple. The owner even helped me carry my duffel bag up to my room. I stayed in room 15 on the 2nd floor (3rd in the US) overlooking a courtyard. Basic single room with small refrigerator, tv and kettle. The shared toilet and shower, steps away from the room, were always clean and I received fresh towels daily. There is a great little restaurant below the hotel towards Dam Square. Albert Heijn is a block away which is very convenient. The only problem I had was the temperature in the room during the day. Can't fault the hotel for the heat wave, but a fan would have been a nice touch. Check out was also a breeze and that's not easy at 5:45 in the morning! All in all, if you are looking for a clean place to sleep Hotel Pax should not be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: flo_geyer
Reviews.Content: After a night at the camping site we decided to move to a hotel. The tourist information at the main train station booked us this hotel. It didn't look like a hotel at the outside, but it was great on the inside. Our room was on the last floor, so we had to go up the stairs everyday (no elevator!). Breakfast was not included, but there's a supermarket, which you can reach within 5 minutes. The city (Damrak) is within 5-7 minutes, westerkerk and the Anne-Frank-Museum is also just around the corner. The tram stops at westerkerk (2-minutes walk). The room was clean, unfortunatly no air condition. It was a great stay, great location, and really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “basic but perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: katiekookaburra
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Schipol and spoke to tourist information. We wanted somewhere CHEAP, expecting to arrive somewhere pretty grim. Pax was great! the guy greeted us with a big smile, showed us where abouts we were on a street map and where we should visit. The room was clean, towels provided. As a place to lay your head each night it was perfect - 49 euros for a twin room was well cheap we thought. The pillows were a bit lumpy but after a few joints who cares!!! ha! great location also.

Reviews.Title: “Pax Was Awesome! ”
Reviews.Author: lalallalalala
Reviews.Content: From the outside, it doesn't look so great, but once you get into your room you realize you lucked out for 30/E a night. You're own shower room /bathroom, a comfortable bed, insanely cool decor and two doors that let out onto a stone balcony, complete with gargoyle. That place was great!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pax
HotelInfo.Address: Raadhuisstraat 37, Amsterdam 2042, The Netherlands
